attributes.action: Require verified ID for anyone wishing to incorporate a Limited Company.
attributes.background: My business has recently been affected by fraud and the fraudster in question has previously been convicted of and imprisoned for such offences. By using a false name, anyone can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public.
attributes.additional_details: By using a false name, fraudsters can easily escape their responsibilities and continue to incorporate new companies to continue to defrauding the public. By introducing ID checks on new company directors, fraud levels could be reduced.

attributes.action: Make the 26-30 railcard pilot available to more than just Greater Anglia users.
attributes.background: As a welcome resource for travelling millennials, the 26-30 railcard was announced in the Chancellor's budget on the 22 November 2017. However, it is currently ONLY being piloted in the Greater Anglia area of the United Kingdom. I urge the government to consider piloting this in more than one area.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, millennials are one of the demographic groups in the UK that are hardest hit in terms of affordability of living. With stagnant wages and rising inflation and for most, a thirst for wanderlust, the 26-30 railcard should've been available as soon as it was announced. Another pressure on millennials is that many commute to their workplaces as majority live with their parents as they are unable to afford a house of their own. I urge the government to pilot this railcard in other areas.

attributes.action: CARIBBEAN DAY is recognized as AUGUST 1st
attributes.background: The UK Caribbean community in several areas including politics, entertainment and sports is an integral part of a socially integrated modern Britain.  This petition seeks that Parliament pronounce  recognition that AUGUST 1st is a date of culture significance for the UK Caribbean community.
attributes.additional_details: The Caribbean and its descendents have been part of Britain’s fortune for centuries. The wealth generated from the colonies provided national means prior to the Industrial Revolution; In the First World War the West Indies Regiment comprised of Caribbean volunteers joined with Britain in time of war and the Caribbean community was present again for WW2, and after Caribbean immigrants answered the call to rebuild Britain’s labour, health and transportation services economy.  A day of remembrance.

attributes.action: Abolish Political Parties and create a collective body of independent MPs.
attributes.background: Great ideas can come from anyone. The possibility that a great idea will fall by the wayside due to some in-built bias of the current Party political/adversarial setup is wrong. Our current Parliamentary system encourages and rewards political bullying (from the whips) and loyalty to the Party line.
attributes.additional_details: Independent MPs would strengthen the relationship (and possibly form new types of relationships) between MPs and their constituents. An MP who today finds it necessary to follow the Party line, which in many cases is against their constituents beliefs, will find it easier to be more in tune with the people they represent and 100% accountable to the same. We have had enough of adversarial wrangling and it is time to try something new - a collective Parliament as is evident anywhere else in nature

attributes.action: Take pitbulls out of the Dangerous Dogs Act
attributes.background: Pitbulls are not dangerous dogs. They are called nanny dogs, they look after their family.  They get blamed for all sorts of bad press. If people treated them with respect like any other dog they would know how loving they are.
attributes.additional_details:
Pitbulls look after their families and they are very loving like any other dog you can see.

They have been more bites off small dogs than a large one

attributes.action: Provide PIP for ALL type 1 diabetics who make a claim
attributes.background: Type 1 diabetes falls under the definition of a disability under the Equality Act 2010, which defines a disability as ‘a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial long-term negative effect on a person’s ability to carry out normal day-to-day activities’. PIP should be awarded to all T1D

attributes.action: Incentivise NHS staff retention by writing off student debt for employees.
attributes.background: NHS staff retention is at an all time low in the current economic climate. A large portion of freshly graduated students are looking for jobs oversees due to a lack of incentive to remain in the NHS and the country. To combat this, we propose eliminating student debt for long term NHS employees.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is for a point based system based on time served. This would mean people would give greater consideration to stay with the NHS for a longer period of time. In return, they would be given a larger reduction in debt in accordance with their time spent in the public services.
In the event of leaving the service, the remaining balance would then be calculated by deducting the  value of time served.  A proposal of 10 -15 years service would see all debt removed.

attributes.action: Fund higher-level classes for profoundly gifted GCSE students
attributes.background: Many highly intelligent pupils feel abandoned by their secondary schools in the UK. Their ability to work and absorb new information at faster rate results in the majority of their time in school being unproductive, wasting time that should be spent realising their potential in academia.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists use cycle paths where provided rather than using roads.
attributes.background:
Why as a cyclist would we want to not use an area dedicated to us for our safety, and irritate motor vehicle drivers by not using what has cost thousands of pounds to provide.
If we use these dedicated cycle ways we will reduce the amount of accidents and injuries to fellow cyclists.

attributes.action: Stop involvement in the Afghan, Syrian and Iraqi Wars and bring troops home
attributes.background: Our involvement as the UK to stop the ongoing wars is the problem.  People are unhappy that we are continuously involved in the different wars and spending too much money on the wars when we could spend it on something useful in the UK. This is a major problem and could assist other campaigns
attributes.additional_details: We are spending a net amount of at least £20.3 billion just until 2010 (combined of only the cost of the afghan and Iraqi war).Many sources state that we are spending at least 37 billion by 2017 a statement by guardian stated “By 2020, Britain will have spent at least £40bn on its Afghan campaign, enough to recruit over 5,000 police officers or nurses and pay for them throughout their careers. It could fund free tuition for all students in British higher education for 10 years."

attributes.action: Make ice cream van drivers pass a DBS check before attaining a trading license
attributes.background: Some ice cream drivers have been abusing their position by grooming and sexually abusing children. Let’s make our children and communities safe. Click the links in “more details” for some articles, google it and you’ll sadly find more. Make it legislation they must pass a DBS check prior to trading.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/wirral-ice-cream-seller-jailed-5373318.amp

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/wfla.com/2017/10/30/man-who-sells-ice-cream-in-bradenton-arrested-for-sexually-assaulting-6-year-old-girl/amp/

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/amp.fox13news.com/news/local-news/ice-cream-man-accused-of-molesting-6-year-old-girl

attributes.action: Amend the National Lottery licence to specify the Operator should be a Charity.
attributes.background:
The UK National Lottery operator Camelot is a profit making Ltd Company which pays large dividends to Shareholders. It is NOT a registered Charity with the Charity Commission.
A requirement of the Licence should be that the operator be a registered not-for-profit Charity. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
Camelot is NOT a Charity and is NOT registered with the Charity Commission. It should be a not-for-profit organisation.
Camelot's majority shareholder is a Parent Company called Premier Lotteries UK Ltd, which in turn is majority owned by a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund, specifically Ontario.
The last 2 year's dividends paid to this Canadian Pension fund (via Premier Lotteries UK Ltd) were £66.6m in 2017 and £84.2m in 2016. These are funds which could be utilised within the UK on good causes.

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Increase the Penalty for NOT STOPPING after an Accident on the Highway by Driver
attributes.background: There are far too many Drivers these days who HIT and RUN, at this time the Penalty is far too Low and needs a Large increase, many are Killed and it is Gutless Not to stop, I know some of these may have a reason like No Insurance or wanted by the Police, they are Cowards when the persons are dying
attributes.additional_details:
In the Media there are cases every week now, this needs Controlling with adverts detailing the Penalty increase, it is a shame where things are going these days making life Cheap.

Let’s try and get things Changed.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on switching the British election system over to MMP
attributes.background: The British FPTP election system has lead to an unproportional Parliament not representing the wants of the British people with parties being able to get a majority with just 30 precent of the vote.
attributes.additional_details:
The British people have never voted on a truly proportional voting system with AV being heavily flawed and with the referendum in question having a turn out of just 40% many voters wanted something else. MMP keeps constituencies and thus the constituent link.
Source:https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixed-member_proportional_representation

attributes.action: Ban spice!
attributes.background: Local towns and cities are getting worse with what we call the zombie plague i.e. legal high SPICE. Businesses are losing out due to people being too scared of this epidemic, less and less people want to go into their local city or local Town! Something needs to be done about this all over the UK.

attributes.action: Include software digital downloads in the Consumer Contracts Regulations (CCR's)
attributes.background: Software digital downloads are exempt from the CCR's. There's a trend developing where developers are producing software which doesn't do as claimed. Customers pay for downloads in advance and cannot get a refund if the software turns out not to be as described. Devs should also release demos first.
attributes.additional_details: This refers to PS4 and XBox digital download stores. Copying software (piracy) was once a problem but with subscriptions to gaming networks and digital signatures this is no longer possible, nor is it possible to use the games without these subscriptions. Some developers are now taking to "hyping" their games to promote pre-orders - to take money first and worry about problems later and there is nothing to stop the developer abandoning game support after sale. The CCR's are being exploited.

attributes.action: Make the purchase of fireworks without a permit & I.D illegal.
attributes.background: The number of emergency calls received by police relating to fireworks & their misuse could be reduced if retailers recorded who they sell to & require the buyer to present a firework permit issued in a similar way that a person may apply for a private event permit meaning less antisocial behaviour
attributes.additional_details:
If you have ever called the police because fireworks are being used in dangerous ways you may have been told its not a priority despite a firework being able to cause major injuries, with a permit and ID required to purchase fireworks less youths will be able to purchase fireworks, to reinforce this 
All retailers should record the details of who bought the fireworks, when, how many of which type. In doing so it will be easy to identify law abiding retailers by checking sales records and stock

attributes.action: Make it illegal for coaches to transport children with inadequate seatbelts
attributes.background: In 2016 4% of road deaths were children (a). The law states very clearly that "you can be fined up to £500 if a child isn’t in the correct seat while you’re driving" (b).  Yet currently minibuses and coaches are exempt; "the law does not require passengers under 14 years old to wear a seat belt" (c)
attributes.additional_details:
(a) https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/648081/rrcgb2016-01.pdf

(b) https://www.gov.uk/seat-belts-law 

(c) http://www.childcarseats.org.uk/the-law/other-vehicles-buses-coaches-and-minibuses/

attributes.action: Health Insurance schemes MUST include cover for counselling & Hypnotherapy
attributes.background: 1 in 4 people are affected by mental health disorders & urgently need access to affordable therapies. The NHS simply cannot cope & our mental health services are in crisis. Astonishingly, the Health Insurance Industry does not consider 'health' to include mental well being & fails to provide cover.
attributes.additional_details:
Why does the Health Insurance Industry provide cover for your body but not for your mind? 

Why can you get cover or claim money back when you see an Acupuncturist/Osteopath/Chiropractor but you can't get the same cover to see a Therapist?

Hypnotherapy is quick & effective treatment for a range of mental health issues, including; anxiety, depression, fears, phobias & addictions - ultimately helping reduce the burden on the NHS. So why is Hypnotherapy not covered under health insurance schemes?

attributes.action: Make government condemn the violence of Spain's police against the Catalans
attributes.background: On the day of the Catalonia independence referendum, Spain's national police used batons and rubber bullets to attack people who were peacefully attempting to cast their vote. Approximately 890 Catalans were injured. Let's make our government stand against brutalising peaceful voters.
attributes.additional_details: The response to a peaceful referendum should never be violence, especially not by the police force that should serve and protect the Catalans. The UK foreign ministry has refused to condemn the Spanish authorities. This is unacceptable to me. I therefore would like to express that I and my fellow citizens do condemn the heinous violence of Spain's national police towards their citizens . Hopefully we will be heard.

attributes.action: Allow teenagers aged 14 and above to vote.
attributes.background: The government's decisions today are the foundation of our lives tomorrow. We say that teenagers aged 14 and above should also get a vote as it's their futures which are affected by government decisions.
attributes.additional_details: Some may argue that young adults under the age of 18 are not responsible enough to be allowed to vote, however, up until now it's always been the adults voting, and as you can see, the world is not in a great political state. They also have a right to have a say in their OWN futures. This is not something to think about, it's an obvious and fundamental change which is extremely vital to children's human rights and needs to happen.

attributes.action: Improve the Ely junction asap! And the east Anglia rail network in general.
attributes.background: The Ely junction needs to be upgraded. And some people in government reconise this. However this project is still being kicked down the road. This needed to happen years ago. No more delays or excuses. Let's pressure the government into speeding the process up now!

attributes.action: No cash transaction after 2025-30
attributes.background:
It would eliminate “black markets” and allow easier monetary policy.
Underground economy in the UK is worth +/- £150bn a year.
It could easily solve problems with the NHS, social housing, investment in research, education etc.
attributes.additional_details:
It would help to “wipe off “ undeclared work and organised crime income.
Cash transactions are less popular each year.
Let’s make the UK a leader and be the first Cashless Nation.

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free of charge in the UK for people diagnosed with IBD
attributes.background: IBD is one of the only chronic illnesses where sufferers have to pay for prescriptions. More often than not they will need medication for life. It is unfair that they have to pay for it when other chronic illnesses are recognised for the purpose of free of charge prescriptions.

attributes.action: A final referendum on EU membership at the same time as a General Election.
attributes.background:
Once this Government has completed their negotiations with the EU27, they should resign and a General Election be called before implementing our departure from the EU.

At the same time a binding referendum on EU membership be held and the subsequent Parliament be obliged to implement the result.
attributes.additional_details: This would ensure a proper debate on the issues, with the electorate clear about the consequences of their votes.  There would be no reason to object to the result with all the facts known and new Parliament elected fully aware of its obligations.

attributes.action: Introduce owner-funded dog DNA register so that Councils can fine owners easier.
attributes.background: Dog fouling is the blight of Britain.Whilst Councils have powers to enforce legislation most don't have the manpower to do this away from town centres. A DNA register would allow a much more efficient prosecution process. People have the right to walk without looking at their feet.
attributes.additional_details: DNA registration is relatively cheap, and economies of scale with a national database would reduce the costs further. This cost would be the responsibility of the owner, and a legal requirement to have a dog DNA registered. Due to the amount of dog fouling, especially on open public spaces away from Wardens/Police, there is very little chance of anyone being fined for letting their dog foul, or picking it up but throwing their dog bag into the hedge.

attributes.action: Ban working MPs and donors of over £5,000 to a political party from honours.
attributes.background: Implementing this ban will reduce the chances of people using their position to get honours, reduce corruption and help those who truly deserve honours receive them.
attributes.additional_details:
Working MPs are a special case compared to working musicians, sportsmen etc. 

Only MPs have the ability to directly affect the government that is in power and the laws within which we all live under and therefore require special rules.

Wealthy people should not use their money to influence a democratically elected government.

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: To make it a legal human right for every UK citizen to have a home.
attributes.background: Homelessness is increasing, human beings should not be living on the streets in the 21st Century. The United Kingdom is a first world country and as a civilised advanced country we should no longer tolerate homelessness for any reason.

attributes.action: Ban LED vehicle headlights
attributes.background: These new LED headlights are horrendous for drivers with any kind of light sensitivity, and probably not great for anyone. I literally put my hand in front of my eyes when a car with these lights approach. Instinctive reflex to protect my eyes, highly dangerous when driving!  Normal headlights fine.

attributes.action: Invest in gridscale battery storage to stabilise wholesale prices of electricity
attributes.background: Renewable energy supply has succeeded in droping wholesale MW prices into negative but without storage nothing is being done to prevent low supply periods seeing prices hikes as high as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. A stable grid, means cheaper bills for consumers and a future for energy suppliers
attributes.additional_details: On 11th June 2017 a record 70% of the electricity for the UK’s homes and businesses was low-carbon. Solar cuts the power demand for National Grid, reducing prices, while wind power also lowers prices. When renewable supply drops however wholesale prices are being ramped higher. Prices can fluctuate between less than £0 and as much as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. Battery storage facilities like the new plant seen in South East Australia would resolve this problem and save the consumer money.

attributes.action: Increase School Funding to local authorities and Stop the Education Cuts.
attributes.background: Over the last two years schools have been forced to reduce the number of school support staff owing to unprecedented cuts in the Government support grant.Those taking the hardest cuts are school support staff who are either made redundant or have to do more by having extra duties without recognition
attributes.additional_details:
Schools should have more than the current funding settlement and the freedom to employ the right level of support staff appropriate to the needs of their pupils with the drive to improve education standards.
They are the backbone of our education system and should be treated with respect. They help the most vulnerable children and schools cannot function without them. As a consequence, many children would struggle and leave school without the qualifications and skills needed in adulthood.

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Make the Monday after Remembrance Sunday a bank holiday.
attributes.background: A lot of people like to travel to the Remembrance Sunday parades. Many of these people are ex-service personnel now working for civilian companies, having the Monday off would allow them to travel to London for example or where they spent much of their service life such as Portsmouth & Plymouth
attributes.additional_details: for the Navy and Aldershot for the Army. They would be able to travel with their families and meet with old comrades and the people who are serving now so they can share memories and stories of old friends who are no longer with us and the places they have been and things they have seen.

attributes.action: Require online retailers and platforms to disclose courier before order placed
attributes.background: When ordering goods online, websites generally do not state which courier service they will use for delivery. However, several courier companies have a track record of poor customer service and losing/damaging parcels. If consumers know which courier will be used, they can choose not to order.
attributes.additional_details: For an example, view the "tweets and replies" at @myhermes

attributes.action: Hold a Public Inquiry into >45000 extra deaths linked to austerity since 2010
attributes.background: A recent study published in the BMJ showed a correlation between cuts to social and healthcare funding and higher than expected national mortality rates since 2010. A Public Inquiry should be held in order to determine whether Government Austerity measures have led to an increase in death rate.
attributes.additional_details:
Long term under funding of health and social care services has led to widespread suffering, a decline physical and mental health and vulnerable people being put at risk. Lack of funding may also be responsible for >45000 deaths since 2010. If this is the case, harmful government action and policy must be reversed and responsible politicians held to account over these deaths.

Study: http://bmjopen.bmj.com/content/7/11/e017722

attributes.action: Make it a criminal,not civil, offence to take part in an unauthorised encampment
attributes.background: Many UK citizens are regularly subjected to anti-social behaviour by people who make camp in their neighbourhood whilst on their travels. Invariably when they move on they leave a considerable amount of mess and damage behind which costs the land owners a significant amount of money to address.
attributes.additional_details: On more than one occasion our local school have been required to pay many thousands of pounds to clean up the children's playing field after travellers had left. There was national outrage recently when travellers left 600 ton of rubbish in a field in Uxbridge. They were not even issued with a ticket for littering! Anyone taking part in an unauthorised encampment must be held legally responsible for leaving the site in the same state as they found it and also prosecuted in the courts.

attributes.action: Prevent UK universities classifying British citizens as international students.
attributes.background:
Currently, a British citizen must live in the UK for the 3 years before starting university. This discriminates against citizens who have lived abroad. 

The loose fee-status specifications allow for different institutions to classify the same student as an international and a home student.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite being a British citizen, I am currently paying £20,000 per year to attend Durham University. 

The Department for Education justifies this by claiming British Citizens who have lived abroad have no access to public funds when they return to the UK, but there is no equivalent barrier to benefits, the NHS, or similar means of public funds. 

This is a call to end the discrimination, not a request to access the Students Loan Company. This is a demand to be treated as equal.

attributes.action: Change the law so that in court each side always pays their own legal costs
attributes.background: Going to court is hugely in favour of the party with the biggest financial clout. They can afford to risk legal costs that the smaller party can't. The smaller party has no control over the larger parties cost yet may have to pay them. There is no other business where you can't control your costs.

attributes.action: Allow Ex-Servicemen to cash in their service pensions.
attributes.background: This would give Ex-Servicement the same rights with their pension pots as similar civilian pension holders.
attributes.additional_details: This would allow the Ex-Servicemen to either buy, upscale or simply reduce their mortgages, thus providing living security. It would also provide the Ex-Servicemen with the exact same options with their pension pots as their civilian counterparts.

attributes.action: Make voting in local & general elections compulsory.
attributes.background: The 'turn-out' at local government elections is abysmal. The resultant problem is that small groups that are motivated by a covert agenda may succeed. A 'fixed penalty' for failing to vote - as applies in Australia & N.Z. - might provide an extra incentive to vote.
attributes.additional_details: District & County Councillors, School Governors, are being elected by a tiny number of electors. Called upon to administer complex issues & substantial budgets, they may be - at best - incompetent, at worst be driven by a motive contrary to that desired by the majority. The ballot slip should include a box labelled 'none of the above', but anyone on the electoral roll who doesn't vote should have to pay a fixed penalty - say £50. Voting 'on line' should also be possible.

attributes.action: Make road cycling safer by introducing a law to enforce reflective clothing.
attributes.background: I am a cyclist and a motorist, but i feel strongly that too many cyclists are not aware that they are not visible in dark clothing. By introducing a law, we can help cut down road traffic accidents involving cyclists and improve their general safety.
attributes.additional_details: My partner and I are members of Catford Cycling Club - which is one of the oldest in the U.K. We have been cycling many years. I regularly have to make cyclists aware that they are not visible on the road.

attributes.action: Pressure the Iraqi government to acknowledge the Kurdish referendum result.
attributes.background: On the 25th September Kurdistan (a region of Iraq) held a referendum on becoming an independent nation and autonomous state. After years of persecution, the Kurds voted for independence. Yet the Iraqi government fail to recognise the result and use troops to suppress the call for independence.

attributes.action: Dart Charge penalty should be reduced to only £10 after 28 days, not £70.
attributes.background: Dart Charge used to be  £1 with members manning the toll gates. There was a big rise to the charge of almost 150%. Now fining motorists for failing to pay £2.50 resulting in £70 bill is unacceptable and should be abolished.

attributes.action: Make food labels clearly state if the product is suitable for vegetarians.
attributes.background: With an estimated 2% of the population of Britain being vegetarian, many people will know the stuggle of scanning through every ingredient on a label trying to work out if they are able to eat the product. With this information so easily known to the manufacturers, it is time for this burden to end.
attributes.additional_details: I have been a vegetarian for over 10 years now and have constantly had trouble while shopping to see if I can actually eat the food on the shelves. I have even had to use my phone in store and search online for this simple answer, and many other families will know this struggle. When it looks like half of the ingredients on food labels now are chemicals I've never even heard of, it seems illogical for the consumer to have to go out of their way to find a simple, but essential, yes or no answer.

attributes.action: Call an immediate election if anything in a manifesto is not actioned as stated
attributes.background: Any amendment to a manifesto in government creates an issue of trust. If a government makes pledges that are unrealistic or exaggerated they should be held to account. Pledges should be time specific. An independent panel of judges will rule, and ask parliament to hold an election as appropriate
